content: What's the name of the largest moon of Jupiter, also known as Jovian Moon?

The largest moon of Jupiter, also known as a Jovian moon, is Ganymede. It is not only the largest moon in Jupiter's system but also the largest moon in the entire Solar System. Ganymede was discovered by Galileo Galilei in 1610. It is one of the four Galilean moons, which also include Io, Europa, and Callisto. Ganymede is unique because it is the only moon known to have its own magnetic field.
